website_summaries.verdict: A quality pitcher with a BPA-free infuser rod. The borosilicate glass construction is resistant to thermal shock.

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job, Just Wish It Were Larger.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to infusing and decided to get a pitcher that would contain the fruit in one place so it wouldn't go pouring over the side of the container and making a mess. This pitcher does the job, and I appreciate that it is glass rather than plastic. The only drawbacks are that I wish the pitcher were larger overall and that there was a little more room for fruit in the infusion compartment. I had been using a gallon glass jar, but I cannot find a glass pitcher even approaching that capacity. So, aside from having to refill quite frequently, this pitcher works well and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Case

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and Functional Infusion Pitcher
customer_reviews.text: Received it right on time. The sparkling, clear glass and the stainless cap are very attractive. Love the slim design, and it fits very easily into my refrigerator. The handle of the pitcher is placed perfectly, and it is easy to grab and hold while pouring. Made a strawberry, lime, cucumber infusion and in the pitcher it made an elegant presentation. Really like the additional strainer at the spout to clear out the little fruit bits before they reach the glass. It is also easy to dismantle and wash. I do hand wash, but it is worth it to keep the glass pretty and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Meline Knago

customer_reviews.title: I like being able to remove the fruit I use after ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a covered infuser for my morning lemon water, and this does the trick. I like being able to remove the fruit I use after the water is infused. There are only two aspects that bother me so far. First is the size. This pitcher is a decent size and gives me 3-4 glasses, but it'd be nice to have more volume in case I entertain or want to have something for a family for more than one meal. Second is pour rate. It doesn't dispense fluid that fast, something that may be a result of the tall, narrow design.

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad

Really, what would in take have a thicker layer of glass on the bottom (like glasses)? We see a day in the not to distant future when we put this down on our granite counters and it cracks. Not sure if we recommend this product or not!

customer_reviews.title: A sound buy.

I know that the glass is supposed to be safe in terms of hot water in making tea, but am a little leery of the infuser standing up to boiling water over time. Consequently I will stick with cold water brewing and will be happy with the pitcher as long as it continues to function as it has after this first usage.

product_meta.title: Glass Water Pitcher with Lid & Fruit Infuser Rod - Borosilicate Glass Carafe W/Up to 50Oz/1500ml Capacity - Stainless Steel Lid, BPA Free Infusion Filter - Perfect for Water, Tea, Sangria, Juice
product_meta.description:
Improve your health with deliciously fresh fruit infused water made from your own professional-grade infusion pitcher!

Water is the single most important resource on Earth and for our bodies. Replenishing and rejuvenating us right down to the cellular level, proper hydration impacts how we feel, our mental clarity, stamina levels, and even how well we sleep. But drinking bland water isn't always enjoyable, which is why we created the Kitchen De Lujo Fruit Infusion Pitcher.

A Healthier Choice

Thanks to the Kitchen De Lujo Fruit Infusion Pitcher, you can infuse boring water with all your favorite fruit and vegetable combinations to make it deliciously unforgettable and even better for your daily health and wellness. From orange/pineapple to mango/cucumber to strawberry/lemon, the possibilities are endless.
